prompt:

Style: Slide 1 – China and Beyond China – Arjun Divecha.  Slide 2 – From China to Beyond China – China has become less attractive. Is this cyclical or secular? Yes. Supply chains are moving out of China for ...
response: Slide 3 – As of 5/31/24 – China – China is not well positioned to take on the U.S. market. Consumer confidence is negative. Retail sales are weak. Industrial activity is slowing. Capital expenditures are down. House prices are down 15%. Tech stocks are down 15%. Market cap down 15%. Demographics are bad – birth rate 10% of 1987.  Slide 4 – As of 5/31/24 – India – India is well positioned to take U.S. dollars. Consumer confidence positive. Retail sales up 15%. Industrial activity up 15%. Capex up 15%. House prices up 15%. Tech stocks up 15%. Market cap up 15%. Demographics improving – dependence on labor coming down.  Slide 5 – As of 4/30/24 – Export growth – U.S. consumption real export growth (Mar) – China -3.5%, Mexico +13.5%, India +13.5%.  Slide 6 – As of 4/30/24 – Market share – U.S. real export market share – China -3.5%, Mexico +5.5%, India +5.5%.
